item.title: I noticed an unusual gap in your semantic graph
item.description: Can you explain that to me? you are having trouble with X.

item.title: The Invention of Stories
item.description: Last night I was thinking about the lifecycle of a genre (how it‚Äôs created, and how it grows). A genre is the simplest type of ‚Äúmeta structure‚Äù (one that I can explain to my mom).

item.title: Culture War -> Culture Science
item.description: STATUS: draft, wording is w/e, but i think this is the right idea If you really think the other side is evil, you MUST try to predict them. This is how you change them, or outcompete them (you can‚Äôt claim to be a good person and refuse to learn about your enemies, while they keep winning & the good guys despair) Every human has been part of a memetics study.

item.title: Too Much Binding Is Harmful
item.description: DUDE HOW I DIDNT SEE THIS BEFORE. HOLY SHIT. SO, NODES THAT FIRE TOGETHER WIRE TOGETHER RIGHT? COOL. SO THIS CREATES A TEMPORAL MYOPIA, WHERE CONNECTED NODES MAY OPTIMIZE FOR FREQUENT COACTIVATION WHICH MIGHT BE HARMFUL FOR THE BROADER NETWORK.
Scratch notes from ‚ÄúWe know how to fix peer review‚Äù It‚Äôs an alignment problem. We can test this empirically, then publish the results in a journal of coordination science.

item.title: Sabine vs McCulloch
item.description: Sabine usually reviews things accurately and with high integrity. In this case she seems to have dismissed with poor reasoning / misrepresentation. This is easy to see when you can see the author‚Äôs response to her video.

item.title: AI Alignment doesn't need more attention
item.description: by Defender We know the correct solution to AI alignment has to be bottom up. We also know that you must answer the question ‚Äúalign to what?‚Äù. The final piece that isn‚Äôt yet widely accepted as far as I can tell is that you CANNOT align AI without aligning humans as well.
